music.name: Afrobeat
music.description: A music genre that combines West African musical styles with American funk and jazz, pioneered by Fela Kuti.
music.influence: Global influence on pop, hip-hop, and dance music

music.name: Reggae
music.description: A music genre that originated in Jamaica in the late 1960s, characterized by a rhythmic style and socially conscious lyrics.
music.influence: Influenced hip-hop, punk, and world music globally

music.name: Jazz
music.description: A music genre that originated in African American communities, characterized by swing, improvisation, and complex harmonies.
music.influence: Foundation for blues, R&B, rock, and hip-hop

music.name: Highlife
music.description: A music genre that originated in Ghana, blending traditional Akan music with Western instruments.
music.influence: Precursor to Afrobeat and influenced West African pop

music.name: Samba
music.description: A Brazilian music genre with roots in African rhythms brought by enslaved Africans.
music.influence: Central to Brazilian culture and Carnival celebrations

music.name: Blues
music.description: A music genre originating from African American communities in the Deep South, characterized by call-and-response patterns.
music.influence: Foundation for rock and roll, R&B, and jazz

food.name: Jollof Rice
food.description: A one-pot rice dish cooked in a flavorful tomato and pepper base, popular across West Africa.

food.name: Injera
food.description: A sourdough flatbread with a spongy texture, used as an edible plate for Ethiopian cuisine.

food.name: Gumbo
food.description: A stew originating from African, French, and Native American influences in Louisiana.

food.name: Jerk Chicken
food.description: Chicken marinated with spicy jerk seasoning and grilled, a signature Jamaican dish.

food.name: Fufu
food.description: A starchy side dish made by pounding cassava, plantains, or yams into a dough-like consistency.

food.name: Feijoada
food.description: A black bean stew with pork, considered Brazil's national dish with African slave origins.

languages.name: Swahili (Kiswahili)
facts: Official language of the African Union

languages.name: Yoruba
facts: Influenced Lucumí in Cuba and Candomblé in Brazil

languages.name: Hausa
facts: Most widely spoken language in West Africa
Used as trade language for centuries
Written in both Latin and Arabic scripts

languages.name: Zulu (isiZulu)
facts: Most widely spoken home language in South Africa

languages.name: Amharic
facts: Second-most spoken Semitic language after Arabic

languages.name: Jamaican Patois
facts: English-based creole with West African influences
